node.display_long_description:
Tom's Guide: #1 Oculus Quest 2 game
Forbes: "One of the best VR games for the Oculus Quest 2"
#1 VR Multiplayer Game for 2020 Holiday


CLIMB, FLY, BUILD. Battle Royale only possible in VR.
 
Drop into a colorful, near future world with limitless combat possibilities. Welcome to POPULATION: ONE, where you and your squad must fight together to survive until the end. 
 
POPULATION: ONE delivers unparalleled vertical freedom and mobility with its unique Vertical combat System. Fly through the map to rain down bullets from above. Climb anything you see to gain the high ground advantage. Build strategic cover to protect your squad. Use your environment to FIGHT ANYWHERE. 
 
In POPULATION: ONE, the action never stops with ongoing live in-game events and fresh content to explore.

CROSS-BUY - Buy for Rift or Quest and get the other free

latest_supported_binary.change_log: The best version of POP: ONE to date!

nodes.title: Weekly POP:ONE Update!
nodes.body_text:
March 18, 2021 Change List

Gameplay

- Guns: Fixed issue where pulling the trigger on guns stuck in a wall would endlessly fire
- Buffs: Lowered Banana & Health Soda spawn chance (spawn ratio for Shield Drink to Health Items is now 4:1)
- M60: Fixed reload issues

General

- Leaderboard: Show the top 25 instead of only the top 10
- Social Currency: Toggle button above right side bar to sort friends list by who hasn't been sent Seeker Silver
- Main Menu: The top 1/3rd of the bottom navigation tab bar is no longer blocked off by an invisible collider
- Store: Fixed issue where helper tool tips would incorrectly show up after making a purchase
- Spectator: Setting height when in spectator mode no longer has a hole
- Localization: Assorted bugfixes

Support

- For support visit http://support.bigboxvr.com to get access to self-help resources or file a ticket

Known Issues

- PC VR: Cannot snap turn or smooth turn while in pods
- Steam VR users playing on an Oculus headset: When Purchasing Bureau Gold, you will need to take off your headset to approve the purchase
- If you see a notice that you need to "update to play" but don't see it in the store, uninstall and reinstall POP: ONE to force the upgrade to happen. You won't lose any progress or data.
​
~ see you in game!

nodes.title: Weekly POP:ONE Update!
nodes.body_text:
March 11, 2021 Change List

Physics (PC VR only)

- PC VR: Fixed issue where climbing or other movement could become jittery
- PC VR: Fixed "random" movement speed fluctuation
- This is an entirely different physics system on PC VR, please let us know if there are any bugs

Gameplay Balance

- Both Sodas: Healing amount doubled (from 25 -> 50)
- Both Sodas: Time to heal doubled
- Both Sodas: Max in inventory slot decreased from 5 -> 3
- AWP: Walk speed reduced to 80% max when AWP is in-hand
- Melee: Knife and sword movement bonus increased from 10% -> 15%

Gameplay Fixes

- Guns: Automatic weapons now start firing again after being stuck through a wall while the trigger is down
- Waypoint Marker: Greatly increased ping distance and limited the loot ping distance
- Compass: Show cardinal directions instead of numbers
- Mutes: A mute will now cross mute (a muted player cannot hear the person that muted them)

General

- Rewards: Impatient update ~ now "Continue" can be pressed to skip the reward/unlock animation
- Store: Fixed discount price not showing correctly
- Battle Menu: Fixed settings menu breaking if open while the match starts
- Post Match: Fixed UI displaying behind the environment
- Spectator: Setting height when in spectator mode no longer has a hole
- Localization: Assorted bugfixes

Support

- For support visit http://support.bigboxvr.com to get access to self-help resources or file a ticket

Known Issues

- PC VR: Cannot snap turn or smooth turn while in pods
- Steam VR users playing on an Oculus headset: When Purchasing Bureau Gold, you will need to take off your headset to approve the purchase
- If you see a notice that you need to "update to play" but don't see it in the store, uninstall and reinstall POP: ONE to force the upgrade to happen. You won't lose any progress or data.
​
~ see you in game!

node.reviewDescription:
I haven't played video games regularly in years. The newest system I own (before this) is an N64. (And btw, all FPS are still measured against Goldeneye).

And this game beat Goldeneye. It definitely has a learning curve. You will not be good at this game right away. The tutorial is a bit lacking, but now with the addition of the bot battles you can get some practice in for the real games.

I read through a bunch of the 1 Star reviews for this game and found a few themes.

1. Parents complaining they bought this game for their kids and were appalled at the killing aspect of the game or the profane speech of some teammates. Parents, DO NOT BUY THIS FOR YOUR KIDS!!!!!!!!!! This is a teen and above game. And I'd even say late teens.

2. People complaining about super rude teammates. I've played almost 400 games by now, and maybe my experience has been different from most, but the VAST majority of my teammates, even if they suck, have been reasonably respectful. By far the most disrespectful are the kids. The kids cuss and swear and scream far more than any adults I've played with. I had one kid who insisted on dropping straight to the cemetery against our advice, die within 30 seconds, call us trash and a bunch of other profane names and left.

3. Then there are the guys that complain about the mechanics; "reloading is too many steps and complicated" (obviously written by a person who has never handled a real gun), "you have to peel a banana four times before you can eat it" (yeah, like a real banana except you don't have to worry about squishing it while you peel it), "the guns are inaccurate," (try shooting a real gun. I assure you hitting someone in this game is far easier than the real thing).

I have my nitpicks with the game as well, particularly coming from a firearms background, but overall I am highly impressed by the game. The better your teamwork the more likely you are to play a good game and win. Legitimate squad tactics (to an extent) are applicable here.
node.reviewTitle: Got me playing VG again after 10+ years
